# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:




* Short name: `mintw`
* Variable label: `month of interview`
* Variable description: `month of interview`
* Domain: `Other administrative variables`
* Value type:`continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done 
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


# Data process
### HRS - HRS - Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variables

The study-specific variable elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `R1IWBEG`
* Label: `Interview Begin Date`
* Type of variable: `countinous`


```{r assign_hrs1, echo=F}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_hrs_w1_dinter','HRS.HRS-HRS-w1_date_of_interview',
                         variables=list('dinterview'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local_hrs1, echo=F}
HRS_hrs_w1_dinter <- opal.execute(o,'HRS_hrs_w1_dinter')
HRS_hrs_w1_dinter$minter <- as.numeric(format(HRS_hrs_w1_dinter$dinterview, '%m'))
Categorical_summary(var = HRS_hrs_w1_dinter$minter, missing_values = NA)
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w1_dinter, aes(x=factor(minter))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Month of interview") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Data process
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable, but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_hrs1}
HRS_ds_hrs_w1 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w1_dinter$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$mintw <- car::recode(HRS_hrs_w1_dinter$minter, "NA=999")
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$mintw <- labelled(HRS_ds_hrs_w1$mintw, labels = c("january"=1, "february"=2, "march"=3, "april"=4, "may"=5, "june"=6, "july"=7, "august"=8, "september"=9, "october"=10, "november"=11, "december"=12, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```


#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_hrs1, echo=F}
Categorical_summary(var = HRS_ds_hrs_w1$mintw, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(HRS_ds_hrs_w1, aes(x=factor(mintw))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Month of interview") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation_hrs1, echo=F}
BeforeH <- table(HRS_hrs_w1_dinter$minter, useNA = "ifany")
AfterH <- table(HRS_ds_hrs_w1$mintw)
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c(names(AfterH)[1:(length(AfterH)-1)], "NA->999")
kable(C)
```





```{r importOPAL_hrs1, echo=F}

#opal.assign.data(o, 'HRS_ds_hrs_w1', HRS_ds_hrs_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'HRS_ds_hrs_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')
mintw <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1
save(mintw, file = "../RData/hrs_w1/mintw.RData")
rm(mintw)

HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1 <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1
HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1$mintw <- car::recode(HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1$mintw, "c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997,998, 999)=NA")
#opal.assign.data(o, 'HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1', HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')
```
